DOC.brief_title: Middle Ear Pressure Disregulation After Tympanostomy Tube Insertion
DOC.detailed_description: This study enroll child 3-6 year age tympanostomy tube insert otitis medium effusion ( OME ) measure middle ear gas demand , middle ear volume eustachian tube function longitudinally time tube insertion extrusion/nonfunctioning . The data use test hypothesis : gas transfer across middle ear mucosa decrease phase resolution middle ear inflammation effusion ; gas transfer across middle ear mucosa increase episode otorrhea ; eustachian tube function unaffected tympanostomy tube insertion , measurement eustachian tube function trans-middle ear mucosa gas transfer predict disease recurrence presentation tube extrusion/nonfunctioning . The result study use support refute test component exist model middle ear pressure-regulation develop test protocol risk assignment respect disease recurrence individual ear tympanostomy tube extrusion/nonfunctioning .
DOC.criteria: 36 year old History chronic otitis medium effusion ( OME ) Scheduled within 6 week tube insertion OME entry surgery Generally good health Cleft palate syndrome predispose OM History recurrent acute otitis medium History complication OM treatment Unable cooperate testing
